page.title: 16LOCAL GOVERNMENT
page.content: The Parish of Mortehoe extends to the borders of the village of Lee to the North, West Down to the East, and Georgeham to the South, with the Atlantic Ocean to the West, and incorporates the busy holiday resort of Woolacombe. It is governed by a three-tier local government system. At grass roots, the Parish Council of 9 elected members, who meet once a month, act as watchdogs for the next tier, the District Council, in advising on planning applications, licencing, maintaining public footpaths, etc. They may strike up to a 5p rate, but owing to revenue from the car park and putting green, have only this year levied a 1p rate, the first for many years. Mortehoe send one elected member to North Devon District Council, the chief planning and licencing authority in the area.
